Hillary Clinton defended Syria President: Assad as a possible reformer at the start of the country's civil war, which was rated as Half True by PunditFact.
The agreement to turn over Syria: s stockpile of chemical weapons was reached in September 2013, seven months after Clinton stepped down as Secretary of State, making McCaskill's claim dubious.
Clinton: s meetings with Russian and United Nations officials in December 2012 about the conflict and her efforts to remove chemical weapons were cited as evidence of her hard work, but these negotiations did not result in any accord with Syria or prevent Assad from using chemical weapons.
